sentence.Network_en: We had this understanding that courses were roughly the same weight.
sentence.Network_cn: 我们已经了解到各门功课差不多一样重要。

sentence.Network_en: At least three British golf courses are now owned by the Japanese.
sentence.Network_cn: 现在英国至少有3家高尔夫球场为日本人所有。

sentence.Network_en: An A-level pass in Biology is preferred for all courses.
sentence.Network_cn: 不管读什么课程，生物学高级证书考试最好都要及格。

list.abs: 课程简介(Course Description)，或是叁考课程时间表(Course Schedule) 等等，都可以得知自己系上所开的课程。
云南师范大学商学院外... ... Course Schedule: 课程安排 Course Objectives: 课程目标 Course Learning Outcomes: 课程学习大纲.
Hkctvdramas ... 浴火凤凰 Phoenix from the Ashes 跑马场 Race Course 麻豆宿舍 Runaway Show.
介词短语_百度百科 ... in the course of 在 …… 过程中，在 …… 期间 of course 当然，自然，无疑 in danger 在危险中，垂危.

entry.tran: 当然(在英语口语中常用于代替 of course)
entry.def: Course is often used in the expression 'of course', or instead of 'of course' in informal spoken English. See 见 of course .

entry.tran: (尤指船或飞机的)航向，航线，路线
entry.def: The course of a vehicle, especially a ship or aircraft, is the route along which it is travelling.

example.ex: Aircraft can avoid each other by going up and down, as well as by altering course to left or right...
example.tran: 飞机可以通过上下升降和左右移动改变航线来避免相撞。

example.ex: The tug was seaward of the Hakai Passage on a course that diverged from the Calvert Island coastline.
example.tran: 托船驶离卡尔弗特岛海岸朝哈凯航道驶去。

entry.def: A course of action is an action or a series of actions that you can do in a particular situation.

example.ex: My best course of action was to help Gill by being loyal, loving and endlessly sympathetic...
example.tran: 我能给吉尔的最大帮助就是对他忠诚、关爱他并且永远满怀同情之心。

example.ex: He must fall on his sword. That's the only course left open to him...
example.tran: 他必须面对失败，他唯有这一条路走。

entry.def: You can refer to the way that events develop as, for example, the course of history or the course of events .

example.ex: ...a series of decisive naval battles which altered the course of history...
example.tran: 改变历史进程的一系列决定性的海战

example.ex: In the natural course of events cows would wish to be milked more than twice a day...
example.tran: 按照事情发展的自然规律，母牛每天应该挤奶两次以上。

entry.def: A course is a series of lessons or lectures on a particular subject.

example.ex: ...a course in business administration...
example.tran: 企业管理课程

example.ex: I'm shortly to begin a course on the modern novel.
example.tran: 我不久将要选修一门现代小说课程。

entry.def: A course of medical treatment is a series of treatments that a doctor gives someone.

example.ex: Treatment is supplemented with a course of antibiotics to kill the bacterium...
example.tran: 治疗期间辅以一个疗程的抗生素注射来杀灭细菌。

example.ex: She went to her doctor, who offered to put her on a course of tranquillizers.
example.tran: 她去看医生，医生建议她服用一个疗程的镇静剂。

entry.def: A course is one part of a meal.

example.ex: The lunch was excellent, especially the first course.
example.tran: 午餐很棒，尤其是第一道菜。

example.ex: ...a three-course dinner.
example.tran: 有3道菜的晚餐

entry.def: In sport, a course is an area of land where races are held or golf is played, or the land over which a race takes place.

example.ex: Only 12 seconds separated the first three riders on the Bickerstaffe course...
example.tran: 比科斯达夫赛场上的前3名骑手之间只差12秒。

example.ex: In July comes the Tour de France, when 200 cyclists cover a course of 2,000 miles.
example.tran: 7月份迎来了环法自行车赛，200名自行车选手要骑行2,000英里的赛程。

entry.def: The course of a river is the channel along which it flows.

example.ex: Romantic chateaux and castles overlook the river's twisting course.
example.tran: 富有浪漫气息的庄园和城堡俯瞰着蜿蜒的河道。

entry.def: If a liquid courses somewhere, it flows quickly.

example.ex: The tears coursed down his cheeks...
example.tran: 他泪如雨下。

example.ex: When you're sitting still, you need less blood coursing through your arteries.
example.tran: 静坐时动脉血液流动较缓。

entry.def: If something happens in the course of a particular period of time, it happens during that period of time.

example.ex: In the course of the 1930s steel production in Britain approximately doubled...
example.tran: 在20世纪30年代，英国的钢铁产量几乎翻了一番。

example.ex: We struck up a conversation, in the course of which it emerged that he was a sailing man.
example.tran: 我们聊了起来，在谈话过程中得知他是一名水手。

entry.def: If you do something as a matter of course, you do it as part of your normal work or way of life.

example.ex: If police are carrying arms as a matter of course then doesn't it encourage criminals to carry them?
example.tran: 如果警察每天理所当然地携带武器，这难道不会促使罪犯也持械吗？

entry.tran: 在正确航道(或航线)上/偏离航道(或航线)
entry.def: If a ship or aircraft is on course, it is travelling along the correct route. If it is off course, it is no longer travelling along the correct route.

example.ex: The ill fated ship was sent off course into shallow waters and rammed by another vessel.
example.tran: 这艘倒霉的船偏离航道误入浅水区，被另外一艘船撞上了。

entry.def: If you are on course for something, you are likely to achieve it.

example.ex: England are well on course for a place at the World Cup Finals...
example.tran: 英格兰队很有可能打进世界杯决赛。

example.ex: The company is on course for profits of £20m in the next financial year.
example.tran: 该公司有望在下一个财年实现2,000万英镑的盈利。

entry.def: If something runs its course or takes its course, it develops naturally and comes to a natural end.

example.ex: They estimated that between 17,000 and 20,000 cows would die before the epidemic had run its course...
example.tran: 他们估计在流行病结束之前会有17,000到20,000头牛死去。

example.ex: As for the imprisoned leaders, he asserted that justice would have to take its course.
example.tran: 他坚称必须对监禁的领导人依法审判。

entry.def: If you stay the course, you finish something that you have started, even though it has become very difficult.

example.ex: The oldest president in American history had stayed the course for two terms.
example.tran: 美国历史上的第一位总统连任两届。

entry.def: If something changes or becomes true in the course of time, it changes or becomes true over a long period of time.

example.ex: In the course of time, many of their myths become entangled.
example.tran: 最后，他们很多荒诞的说法都变得错综复杂了。

auth_sentence.content: The chefs try to impress with their fish courses.
auth_sentence.res_content: The chefs try to impress with their fish courses.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The chefs try to impress with their fish courses.

auth_sentence.res_content: The three Northern Ireland chefs cook their fish courses.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The three Northern Ireland chefs cook their fish courses.

auth_sentence.content: The chefs in central England cook their main courses.
auth_sentence.res_content: The chefs in central England cook their main courses.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The chefs in central England cook their main courses.

Sentence.sentence: The academic value of the courses.
Try to take a variety of practical courses
tackle the demanding biology and physics courses
It includes a great variety of practical courses.
Summer courses are not required, but a student may enroll in them—and pay extra.
There are no changes in the number of courses professors teach or in their pay
